DefaultEvent.Description:
Your zailors are keen to tramp themselves a place. "Fruit falls right off the tree, captain!" one enthuses. "And we'll be, what, your Parliament, right? Allus thought I'd make a good M.P."

"But what're we going to call the island?" one asks.
DefaultEvent.Name: A kind of paradise

ChildBranches.Name: Establish your colony in earnest
ChildBranches.Description: Put ten volunteers ashore here, with enough supplies, building materials and cutlery to civilise this desert isle.

DefaultEvent.Description: Day by day, the walls rise higher, the gardens grow tidier, the hats become grander. Probably zailors will always spit in the street, but one day soon you may have a street for them to spit in.
DefaultEvent.Name: Your estate grows!

ChildBranches.Name: Improve your estate
ChildBranches.Description: Bricks, barrels, glass, books, pianos, antimacassars, tea. All the components of civilisation. [You must increase your Estate quality to 100 before declaring yourself a nation.]

DefaultEvent.Description: Perhaps one day they'll want to return home; perhaps this will be their home. Perhaps the zee's call will be irresistible again some day. Either way, they seem happy with the sunshine, and the peace.
DefaultEvent.Name: Retirement, of sorts

ChildBranches.Name: Increase your population
ChildBranches.Description: Suggest to five crew that they might want to remain ashore. [You must increase your population to 77 before declaring yourself a nation.]

DefaultEvent.Description: "I can't say I'd ever expected this to be my retirement. But it's a charming place, isn't it? Thank you for the trust you repose in me. I will ensure it is not misplaced."
DefaultEvent.Name: "An honour!"

ChildBranches.Name: Install a viceroy - the Satisfied Magician
ChildBranches.Description: You'll need someone to rule in your absence. He's proven himself intelligent, charismatic and trustworthy, now that his quest for revenge is complete.

DefaultEvent.Description: "You've made the right choice. I'll see that things are done properly round here from now on. And... thank you."
DefaultEvent.Name: "Excellent."

ChildBranches.Name: Install a viceroy - the Indomitable Campaigner
ChildBranches.Description: You'll need someone to rule in your absence. She'd probably be alarmingly good at this, now that her illness is cured.

DefaultEvent.Description: "Yes. We must do the best we can. And here, I will do the best I can. Thank you. You have changed everything for me, and I will try not to disappoint you."
DefaultEvent.Name: "Thank you for your trust..."

ChildBranches.Name: Install a viceroy - the Disillusioned Doctor
ChildBranches.Description: You'll need someone to rule in your absence. He's a realist, now. He might not be the most vigorous governor, but he's loyal.

ChildBranches.Name: Declare yourself a nation
ChildBranches.Description: When your estate and your population are great enough, you can declare yourself a nation - albeit a minor one - and complete this ambition! You will need to choose a great power to ally yourself with, or go it alone - choose this option to see the requirements.

DefaultEvent.Description: Your citizens provide what they can. It's not the best quality fuel, but it'll take you where you need to go.
DefaultEvent.Name: Wood and zea-coal

ChildBranches.Name: Collect Fuel
ChildBranches.Description: It is the least your people could give you. [This will expend one point of Estate to gain 30 points of Fuel.]

DefaultEvent.Description: Not the actual spider's web. That's at Saviour's Rocks, and you wouldn't want to found a kingdom there. But you are placing yourself at the centre of a figurative, civilised spider's web: kingmaker, and one day, king...
DefaultEvent.Name: The centre of the spider's web

ChildBranches.Name: Knowledge is Power
ChildBranches.Description: Use Vital Intelligence to lay plans and win leverage. [This will increase Estate by 3; you can do it up to five times.]

DefaultEvent.Description: Your workers' eyes are bright. Their smiles are wide. Their songs are rapid.
DefaultEvent.Name: A better grind

ChildBranches.Name: Coffee is Power
ChildBranches.Description: Darkdrop Coffee will energise your labourers. There are risks, of course. There are always risks. But if their hearts burst, it's probably from happiness. [This will increase Estate by 2; you can do it up to 5 times.]

DefaultEvent.Description: It's not really a throne room. Throne rooms are terribly eighteenth-century. But it is a very grand study. Any visitor will be suitably awed; and they needn't know if you use the thing mostly as a paperweight.
DefaultEvent.Name: A hall of legend

ChildBranches.Name: Wealth is Power
ChildBranches.Description: Enshrine and boast of your treasures, to increase your prestige. [This will increase Estate by 5; you can do it up to five times.]

DefaultEvent.Description: Your crew bask and loaf. It's not quite sunlight - they'll never tan, and they won't particularly die - but the fruit is ripe; the leaves are green; the waves are lazuli. The night retreats.
DefaultEvent.Name: Days in the semi-sun

ChildBranches.Name: Time ashore
ChildBranches.Description: There's enough here for your zailors to pretend it's civilisation. Those of them that like civilisation. [This will reduce your Terror by ten points at a cost of 1 Supply.]

DefaultEvent.Description: This land is yours; this ship is yours.
DefaultEvent.Name: A satisfactory result

ChildBranches.Name: Repair your ship
ChildBranches.Description: This little drydock isn't exactly the Admiralty Shipyards; but you can manage repairs that would be impossible at zee. [This will completely repair your Hull at a cost of seven Supplies.]

Description: One day, perhaps, your kingdom. [Improving your colony into a kingdom will end, and win, the game.]
Name: Your Colony
